Camera I: Principles & Practices of Cinematography: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Camera I: Principles & Practices of Cinematography  FMTV-UT.1065 Studio 3 Credits Course Level: Fundamental     Course is not repeatable Prerequisites: Sight & Sound: Film (H56.0043)    This course assumes the successful completion of Fundamentals of Sight & Sound Film. It will review B&W theory, cover color theory, and give an introduction to lighting and grip equipment. Basic lighting setups, as well as in-camera effects, are demonstrated and analyzed and will be shot on 16mm film. Only half of the students in the class will get to shoot for one day during the semester. The other half of the students will assist in the shoots. This class is 8 weeks of theory and 6 weeks of shooting. Check descriptions for the different levels of the courses. Some courses may not be offered in a given academic year. Consult each semester's schedule for specific information.    Click on a course title in the related links to the right to read the course description.
